newsitem.title: USA: Long Island Bancorp Q4 includes charges.
newsitem.headline: Long Island Bancorp Q4 includes charges.

text.p: Long Island Bancorp Inc said Tuesday that results for the fourth quarter of fiscal 1996 include the effect of a one-time SAIF insurance assessment of $18.7 million and the one-time costs related to the president's retirement of $0.05 per share.

In a release Tuesday the company said that excluding the effect of the charges, net income for the fourth quarter of 1996 would have been $10.1 million and primary and fully diluted earnings per share would have been $0.43.
The company reported a net loss of $1.9 million and primary and fully diluted loss per share of $0.08 for the fourth quarter of 1996.
For the 1995 fourth quarter, the company reported net income of $11.9 million and primary and fully diluted earnings per share of $0.47.
